title: Classic Beef Bolognese
shortDescription: A rich, slow-cooked Italian meat sauce served over pasta.
ingredients:
500g beef mince
1 onion, diced
2 carrots, diced
2 celery sticks, diced
3 cloves garlic, minced
400g tin chopped tomatoes
2 tbsp tomato paste
150ml red wine
1 tsp dried oregano
 Salt and pepper
Olive oil
Parmesan to serve
method:
1. Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Brown the mince, breaking it up, then set aside.
2. In the same pan, sauté onion, carrot and celery for 8 minutes until softened.
3. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
4. Return the mince to the pan. Add tomato paste and stir for 2 minutes.
5. Pour in the red wine and let it bubble for 2 minutes.
6. Add chopped tomatoes, oregano, salt and pepper. Stir well.
7. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for at least 45 minutes, stirring occasionally.
8. Serve over spaghetti with freshly grated Parmesan.
comments: Better the next day. Freezes well.

title: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup
shortDescription: Velvety smooth soup with warming spices.
ingredients:
1 large butternut squash, peeled and cubed
1 onion, roughly chopped
2 cloves garlic
1 tsp ground cumin
1/2 tsp smoked paprika
750ml vegetable stock
2 tbsp olive oil
Salt and pepper
Crème fraîche to serve
method:
1. Preheat oven to 200°C.
2. Toss squash, onion and garlic with olive oil, cumin, paprika, salt and pepper on a baking tray.
3. Roast for 35–40 minutes until tender and caramelised.
4. Transfer to a large pot, add stock, and bring to a simmer.
5. Blend until smooth with a stick blender.
6. Adjust seasoning and serve with a swirl of crème fraîche.
comments: Can add a pinch of chilli flakes for heat.
